verses.kjv: The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond: it is graven upon the table of their heart, and upon the horns of your altars;
verses.web: “The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond. It is engraved on the tablet of their heart, and on the horns of your altars.
verses.ct: "Judah's sin is etched with an iron pen, carved with a diamond point. It's engraved on the tablet of their heart and on the horns of their altars.

verses.kjv: Whilst their children remember their altars and their groves by the green trees upon the high hills.
verses.web: Even their children remember their altars and their Asherah poles by the green trees on the high hills.
verses.ct: Even their children remember the pagan altars and Asherah poles standing beside green trees on the high hills.

verses.kjv: O my mountain in the field, I will give thy substance and all thy treasures to the spoil, and thy high places for sin, throughout all thy borders.
verses.web: My mountain in the field, I will give your substance and all your treasures for a plunder, and your high places, because of sin, throughout all your borders.
verses.ct: My mountain in the open country — I will hand over your wealth and all your treasures as plunder, along with your high places, because of sin throughout your land.

verses.kjv: And thou, even thyself, shalt discontinue from thine heritage that I gave thee; and I will cause thee to serve thine enemies in the land which thou knowest not: for ye have kindled a fire in mine anger, which shall burn for ever.
verses.web: You, even of yourself, will discontinue from your heritage that I gave you. I will cause you to serve your enemies in the land which you don’t know, for you have kindled a fire in my anger which will burn forever.”
verses.ct: You will lose the inheritance I gave you, and by your own doing. I will make you serve your enemies in a land you've never known, because you have lit a fire in my anger that will burn forever."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Cursed be the man that trusteth in man, and maketh flesh his arm, and whose heart departeth from the LORD.
verses.web: LORD says: “Cursed is the man who trusts in man, relies on strength of flesh, and whose heart departs from LORD.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Cursed is the person who trusts in human strength, who relies on mere flesh for power, and whose heart turns away from the LORD.

verses.kjv: For he shall be like the heath in the desert, and shall not see when good cometh; but shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness, in a salt land and not inhabited.
verses.web: For he will be like a bush in the desert, and will not see when good comes, but will inhabit the parched places in the wilderness, an uninhabited salt land.
verses.ct: That person will be like a shrub in the desert — they won't even notice when good things come. They'll live in scorched wastelands, in a salty, barren land where no one dwells.

verses.kjv: Blessed is the man that trusteth in the LORD, and whose hope the LORD is.
verses.web: “Blessed is the man who trusts in LORD, and whose confidence is in LORD.
verses.ct: But blessed is the person who trusts in the LORD, whose confidence rests in him.

verses.kjv: For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters, and that spreadeth out her roots by the river, and shall not see when heat cometh, but her leaf shall be green; and shall not be careful in the year of drought, neither shall cease from yielding fruit.
verses.web: For he will be as a tree planted by the waters, who spreads out its roots by the river, and will not fear when heat comes, but its leaf will be green, and will not be concerned in the year of drought. It won’t cease from yielding fruit.
verses.ct: That person will be like a tree planted beside a stream, sending its roots down toward the water. It doesn't panic when the heat comes — its leaves stay green. It has no worry in a year of drought and never stops producing fruit.

verses.kjv: The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?
verses.web: The heart is deceitful above all things and it is exceedingly corrupt. Who can know it?
verses.ct: The human heart is more deceitful than anything else, and desperately wicked. Who can truly understand it?

verses.kjv: I the LORD search the heart, I try the reins, even to give every man according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings.
verses.web: “I, LORD, search the mind. I try the heart, even to give every man according to his ways, according to the fruit of his doings.”
verses.ct: "I, the LORD, search the mind and examine the heart. I reward each person according to how they live and what their actions produce."

verses.kjv: As the partridge sitteth on eggs, and hatcheth them not; so he that getteth riches, and not by right, shall leave them in the midst of his days, and at his end shall be a fool.
verses.web: As the partridge that sits on eggs which she has not laid, so is he who gets riches, and not by right. In the middle of his days, they will leave him. At his end, he will be a fool.
verses.ct: Like a partridge that sits on eggs it didn't lay, so is the person who gains wealth dishonestly. Halfway through life, those riches will slip away, and in the end, that person will be exposed as a fool.

verses.kjv: A glorious high throne from the beginning is the place of our sanctuary.
verses.web: A glorious throne, set on high from the beginning, is the place of our sanctuary.
verses.ct: Our sanctuary is a glorious throne, exalted from the very beginning.

verses.kjv: O LORD, the hope of Israel, all that forsake thee shall be ashamed, and they that depart from me shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken the LORD, the fountain of living waters.
verses.web: LORD, the hope of Israel, all who forsake you will be disappointed. Those who depart from me will be written in the earth, because they have forsaken LORD, the spring of living waters.
verses.ct: LORD, you are the hope of Israel! Everyone who abandons you will be put to shame. Those who turn away from me will have their names written in the dust, because they have forsaken the LORD, the fountain of living waters.

verses.kjv: Heal me, O LORD, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved: for thou art my praise.
verses.web: Heal me, O LORD, and I will be healed. Save me, and I will be saved; for you are my praise.
verses.ct: Heal me, LORD, and I will be healed. Save me, and I will be saved — for you are the one I praise.

verses.kjv: Behold, they say unto me, Where is the word of the LORD? let it come now.
verses.web: Behold, they ask me, “Where is LORD’s word? Let it be fulfilled now.”
verses.ct: Look — people keep taunting me, saying, "So where is this word from the LORD? Let's see it happen already!"

verses.kjv: As for me, I have not hastened from being a pastor to follow thee: neither have I desired the woeful day; thou knowest: that which came out of my lips was right before thee.
verses.web: As for me, I have not hurried from being a shepherd after you. I haven’t desired the woeful day. You know. That which came out of my lips was before your face.
verses.ct: As for me, I haven't run away from my calling as your shepherd. I never wished for this day of disaster. You know that, LORD. Every word that came from my lips was spoken in your presence.

verses.kjv: Be not a terror unto me: thou art my hope in the day of evil.
verses.web: Don’t be a terror to me. You are my refuge in the day of evil.
verses.ct: Don't become a source of terror to me. You are my refuge when disaster strikes.

verses.kjv: Let them be confounded that persecute me, but let not me be confounded: let them be dismayed, but let not me be dismayed: bring upon them the day of evil, and destroy them with double destruction.
verses.web: Let them be disappointed who persecute me, but let not me be disappointed. Let them be dismayed, but don’t let me be dismayed. Bring on them the day of evil, and destroy them with double destruction.
verses.ct: Let those who persecute me be put to shame — but don't let me be shamed. Let them be filled with dread — but spare me from it. Bring the day of disaster on them, and shatter them with double destruction.

verses.kjv: Thus said the LORD unto me; Go and stand in the gate of the children of the people, whereby the kings of Judah come in, and by the which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;
verses.web: LORD said this to me: “Go and stand in the gate of the children of the people, through which the kings of Judah come in and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: The LORD told me, "Go stand at the gate where the common people pass through — the one the kings of Judah use to enter and leave — and stand at every gate of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And say unto them, Hear ye the word of the LORD, ye kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, that enter in by these gates:
verses.web: Tell them, ‘Hear LORD’s word, you kings of Judah, all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, that enter in by these gates:
verses.ct: Tell them, 'Listen to the word of the LORD, you kings of Judah, all you people of Judah, and everyone living in Jerusalem who passes through these gates:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Take heed to yourselves, and bear no burden on the sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem;
verses.web: LORD says, “Be careful, and bear no burden on the Sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: Watch yourselves carefully! Don't carry any loads on the Sabbath day, and don't bring them through the gates of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the sabbath day, neither do ye any work, but hallow ye the sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.
verses.web: Don’t carry a burden out of your houses on the Sabbath day. Don’t do any work, but make the Sabbath day holy, as I commanded your fathers.
verses.ct: Don't carry loads out of your houses on the Sabbath. Don't do any work at all. Keep the Sabbath day holy, just as I commanded your ancestors.

verses.kjv: But they obeyed not, neither inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, nor receive instruction.
verses.web: But they didn’t listen. They didn’t turn their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, and might not receive instruction.
verses.ct: But they refused to listen. They wouldn't pay attention. Instead, they stiffened their necks so they wouldn't have to hear or accept correction.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, if ye diligently hearken unto me, saith the LORD, to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the sabbath day, but hallow the sabbath day, to do no work therein;
verses.web: It will happen, if you diligently listen to me,” says LORD, “to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, but to make the Sabbath day holy, to do no work therein;
verses.ct: Now, if you truly obey me," declares the LORD, "and bring no loads through the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, but instead keep the Sabbath holy by doing no work —

verses.kjv: Then shall there enter into the gates of this city kings and princes sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they, and their princes, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: and this city shall remain for ever.
verses.web: then there will enter in by the gates of this city kings and princes sitting on David’s throne, riding in chariots and on horses, they, and their princes, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and this city will remain forever.
verses.ct: then kings and princes who sit on David's throne will continue to enter through the gates of this city, riding in chariots and on horses — they and their officials, along with the people of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem. And this city will stand forever.

verses.kjv: And they shall come from the cities of Judah, and from the places about Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the plain, and from the mountains, and from the south, bringing burnt offerings, and sacrifices, and meat offerings, and incense, and bringing sacrifices of praise, unto the house of the LORD.
verses.web: They will come from the cities of Judah, and from the places around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin, from the lowland, from the hill country, and from the South, bringing burnt offerings, sacrifices, meal offerings, and frankincense, and bringing sacrifices of thanksgiving, to LORD’s house.
verses.ct: People will come from the towns of Judah, from the villages around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin, from the western foothills, from the hill country, and from the southern desert. They'll bring burnt offerings, sacrifices, grain offerings, frankincense, and offerings of thanksgiving to the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: But if ye will not hearken unto me to hallow the sabbath day, and not to bear a burden, even entering in at the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath day; then will I kindle a fire in the gates thereof, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched.
verses.web: But if you will not listen to me to make the Sabbath day holy, and not to bear a burden and enter in at the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle a fire in its gates, and it will devour the palaces of Jerusalem. It will not be quenched.” ’ ”
verses.ct: But if you refuse to listen to me and won't keep the Sabbath holy — if you carry loads through the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day — then I will set fire to those gates, and it will consume the palaces of Jerusalem with a blaze that no one can put out.'"
